main event: A diamond-shaped white object the size of a baseball was seen flying southwest at an altitude of 20,000 feet and a speed of 500 knots for 15 minutes in Macon, Georgia on November 6, 1957.
interesting points: The object was described as having a diamond shape with red lights in the lower right and left corners.
Multiple witnesses, including a physical therapist, cashier, mechanic, and housewife, observed the object.
The object was initially spotted by Mrs. [REDACTED], who then called the other observers to come watch it.
The object made a 90-degree ascent from approximately 150 feet above the ground to its reported altitude of 20,000 feet.
The object's description, flight path, and duration indicate it was likely an aircraft, but the report states the speed and altitude would not have allowed it to be in sight for 15 minutes.
